name: market for internet access, work, 0.2 Mbit/s | internet access, work, 0.2 Mbit/s | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5113/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'internet access, work, 0.2 Mbit/s', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;The 'internet access, work, 0.2 Mbit/s' is delivering the service of operation of an IP network for work at home, per person, for one hour. The IP core network device represents a Cisco Service Router 1800 Series, with maximal data rate of 100 Mbit/s and a power demand of 0.0042 kW at 1 Mbit/s. The operation includes the router and its electricity consumption. 

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: J:Information and communication/61:Telecommunications/611:Wired telecommunications activities/6110:Wired telecommunications activities
